page.title: 13The Roman Town at Wroxeter
page.content: The Roman town at{Wroxeter}was called{Viroconium}and it was a military outpost.There is now a museum where you can see rocks,bones and skulls which have been excavated and the entrance to the baths called the north wall.This wall is made out of sand stone and flat red bricks. It is 28 metres long and about 8 metres high.There were nine baths some cold and some heated.You can see small pillars built to heat the baths.Some of the rocks remaining have trade marks on them like a large thumb print,from the Romans who made them. When the town was built it covered an area of 170 acres making it the fourth largest city in Roman Britain.
